Subject: ECOCORE:00000042
Value: a reproductive quality inhering in the bearer by virtue of the bearer having reproductive organs normally associated with both male and female sexes at the same time

Subject: ECOCORE:00000043
Value: a reproductive quality inhering in the bearer by virtue of the bearer having female reproductive organs at the beginning of its life and then switching to male reproductive organs

Subject: ECOCORE:00000045
Value: heterotroph that acquires nutrition from a symbiont

Subject: ECOCORE:00000048
Value: anatomical entity that comprises the organism in a distinct juvenile form that is provided with a source of nutrition, usually a yolk sac, to use before metamorphosing into an adult

Subject: ECOCORE:00000049
Value: a community of microscopic, unicellular eukaryotic algae and the prokaryotic Cyanobacteria which live on sediment surfaces

Subject: ECOCORE:00000054
Value: heterotroph that obtains nutrition by breaking down dead or decaying organisms or other organic matter

Subject: ECOCORE:00000067
Value: a member of one sex mates with any member of the opposite sex

Subject: ECOCORE:00000095
Value: a predator residing at the top of a food chain upon which no other creatures prey.

Subject: ECOCORE:00000096
Value: a predator that captures or traps prey by stealth or strategy, rather than by speed or strength.

Subject: ECOCORE:00000097
Value: a detritivore that consumes leaf litter

Subject: ECOCORE:00000098
Value: a heterotroph that consumes bacteria

Subject: ECOCORE:00000117
Value: a reproductive quality inhering in the bearer by virtue of the bearer having male reproductive organs at the beginning of its life and then switching to female reproductive organs

Subject: ECOCORE:00000118
Value: a reproductive quality inhering in the bearer by virtue of the bearer having female reproductive organs at the beginning of its life and then switching to being a hermaphrodite

Subject: ECOCORE:00000119
Value: a reproductive quality inhering in the bearer by virtue of the bearer having male reproductive organs at the beginning of its life and then switching to being a hermaphrodite

Subject: ECOCORE:00000120
Value: a reproductive quality inhering in the bearer by virtue of the bearer changing sex at some point in its life

Subject: ECOCORE:00000167
Value: a folivore that lives in and eats the leaf tissue of plants

Subject: ECOCORE:00000168
Value: an herbivore that primarily consumes grasses, leaves, and other soft plant material

Subject: ECOCORE:00000170
Value: a carnivore that primarily eats organisms less than 1 cm in their longest dimension

Subject: ECOCORE:00000171
Value: an organism that uses inorganic sulfur compounds as a terminal electron acceptor during cellular respiration

Subject: ECOCORE:00000172
Value: an organism that does not require oxygen for growth

Subject: ECOCORE:00000173
Value: an organism that can survive and grow in an oxygenated environment

Subject: ECOCORE:00000174
Value: an organism capable of producing all amino acids required for its growth

Subject: ECOCORE:00000175
Value: an organism that is unable to synthesize a particular organic compound required for its growth

Subject: ECOCORE:00000176
Value: a decomposer which obtains nutrition by consuming feces

Subject: ECOCORE:00000177
Value: an anaerobe that makes ATP by aerobic respiration if oxygen is present, but is capable of switching to fermentation if oxygen is absent.

Subject: ECOCORE:00000178
Value: an anaerobe that cannot grow in the presence of oxygen

Subject: ECOCORE:00000179
Value: an aerobe that requires oxygen to grow

Subject: ECOCORE:00000180
Value: an aerobe that can grow at oxygen levels lower than what is present in the atmosphere

Subject: ECOCORE:00000181
Value: an anaerobe that can tolerate low levels of oxygen
